Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of people who have given up looking for jobs.
Understate: The claim understates the number of jobs that will still move to Mexico despite the deal negotiated by Trump.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support for the statement that "they want to work" without providing any evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all 96 million people who are not in the labor force want to work, which may not be accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why people may have given up looking for jobs, such as retirement or disability.
